title: Export from script
question: I’m using rs.Command(“_Export”) in a script.  Is there some way to call Export and have the script specify what file format I want so I don’t have to pick it from the list, and still let me name the file myself with the export dialog?

code_blocks.code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
import os

filename=rs.StringBox("Filename",title="Save DXF file as")
folder=rs.WorkingFolder() #or can use specific hard coded folder
fullpath=os.path.join(folder,filename+".dxf")
print fullpath
code_blocks.author: Helvetosaur

code_blocks.code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
import os

folder=rs.BrowseForFolder() #user selects folder
filename=rs.StringBox("Filename",title="Save DXF file as")
fullpath=os.path.join(folder,filename+".dxf")
print fullpath
code_blocks.author: Helvetosaur

code_blocks.code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs

dxf_filt="DXF files|*.dxf||"
fullpath=rs.SaveFileName("Save .dxf file",dxf_filt)
print fullpath
code_blocks.author: Helvetosaur
James_Richters
